It is the authoritative source of information on nationally recognised training and registered training organisations. It is central to the operation of the vocational education and training (VET) sector as it provides access to a reliable, trusted, and valued set of resources for industry, governments, and VET professionals.

The National Training Register Enhancement Project (the Project) aims to implement a suite of changes to the current platform to ensure it is up to date, responsive and able to meet future business needs.

The Department of Industry, Science and Resources (DISR) strives to encourage the sustainable growth of Australian industries including the delivery of a national innovation system to drive knowledge creation, international competitiveness and greater productivity. 

The CIO Group provides a range of enabling services and operations delivery to the department and to Australian businesses and are seeking Digital Analysts to work in a high performing, fast paced customer service focused team environment, under direction of the Digital Support Services Team Leads. 

Role and requirements:
We are looking for a Digital Support Analyst to work in a high performing, fast paced customer service focussed team environment, under direction of the Digital Support Services Team Leads.

Digital Support Analysts provide level 1 IT help desk support to users of the Department's Information and Communications Technology (ICT).

The Analysts respond to user enquiries, assess problems and issues with the Departments ICT hardware and software and help to resolve these issues for end users, providing an excellent customer experience.  

Digital Analysts provide support via four channels:  phone, email, an online portal (Service Now), live agent chat and face to face.

We are looking for a Digital Support Analyst to work in a high performing, fast paced customer service focussed team environment, under direction of the Digital Support Services Team Leads.

The Critical Infrastructure Operational Technology Environments (CIOTE) section within the Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) is responsible for driving the cyber security outcomes for critical infrastructure around Australia, with a primary focus on operational technology. The CIOTE section works with critical infrastructure owners and operators to understand and uplift their cyber security.

The ICT Network Security Engineer plans, implements, and operates network services/systems, to include hardware and virtual environments.
The person will possess broad knowledge in:

• Test and maintain network infrastructure including software and hardware devices
• Provide feedback on network requirements, including network architecture and infrastructure
• Provide feedback on maintaining network infrastructure devices and network backup and recovery procedures
• Integrate new system’s into existing network architecture
• Diagnose network connectivity problem

The Business Analyst will work within the blended delivery teams, to ensure that business requirements are understood, clearly defined, and are being met through successful project delivery. 

The role will also work closely with Project Managers, Assistant Directors and a range of internal and external stakeholders, to lead and deliver a range of projects in order to successfully achieve AER objectives in relation to the AER’s IT and data projects.

Duties:

  • Under direction from the Project Manager and the Project Board, collaboratively contribute to deliver high-quality business outcomes for the AER using facilitation skills, with a strong focus on innovation and the end-user experience.

  • Collaborate with product owners and project management to refine product roadmaps, and build and refine product backlogs to ensure the most appropriate prioritisation and delivery scheduling aligned to business value
  • Engage in all Scrum events, assisting with sprint planning, backlog refinement and ordering, requirements comprehension, and delivery improvements
  • Develop test scripts and execute end-to-end functional and non-functional tests

requirements.description:
About the Project

At Geoscience Australia in Canberra, there are two robotic systems: one is small Geo++ robot which was built for Global Navigation Satellite Signal (GNSS) antenna calibrations; and a Kuka robot, which was built for GNSS antenna calibrations with heavier payloads (>10kg) and other research applications. 

This project is to develop an operational GNSS antenna calibration facility using the Kuka robot. We are seeking a robotic engineer to develop the robotic antenna calibration program, the work details are listed as below: 

  1. Develop robotic machine language (Kuka robotic language, KRL) scripts to talk to the Kuka robot to move in parallel to the Geo++ robot;
  2. Develop scripts to work out the geometric relationship for each modules to control the Kuka robot for orientating GNSS antenna;
  3. Develop scripts to link the Kuka robot and GNSS receiver antennas to log data for post processing of GNSS antenna calibrations;
  4. Integrating the above scripts/functions into a software package for GNSS antenna calibrations;
  5. Documentation of the above development scripts/functions.

(see attached requirement document for the full description)

The successful seller will need to ensure at least one engineer work with the project in full time with claimed skills.
Skill and knowledge in writing robotic language programming, Kuka robot experience desirable, preferring to providing examples of past work with similar project.

Role:

The Business Analyst will work within the blended delivery teams, to ensure that business requirements are understood, clearly defined, and are being met through successful project delivery. 

The role will also work closely with Project Managers, Assistant Directors and a range of internal and external stakeholders, to lead and deliver a range of projects in order to successfully achieve AER objectives in relation to the AER’s IT and data projects.

Duties:

  • Under direction from the Project Manager and the Project Board, collaboratively contribute to deliver high-quality business outcomes for the AER using facilitation skills, with a strong focus on innovation and the end-user experience.
  • Manage and foster relationships with internal and external stakeholders to understand the structure, policies, and operations of the AER, elicit requirements, challenge assumptions, recommend solutions and secure alignment
  • Assist in communicating business analysis outcomes so that they are well understood and agreed by all impacted stakeholders and project team members
  • Analyse the problem domain, its processes, systems and data, to build domain expertise in pursuit of delivering thought leadership to guide solution design, discover new solution opportunities, identify business impacts, and mitigate project risks and issues
  • Capture knowledge, requirements/features, and designs in documents, presentations, and backlog items to direct project deliverables, communicate ideas and concepts, and inform team decision-making
  • Collaborate with product owners and project management to refine product roadmaps, and build and refine product backlogs to ensure the most appropriate prioritisation and delivery scheduling aligned to business value
  • Engage in all Scrum events, assisting with sprint planning, backlog refinement and ordering, requirements comprehension, and delivery improvements
  • Develop test scripts and execute end-to-end functional and non-functional tests
  • Support user acceptance testing, production verification testing and release management, to assure quality outcomes and maximise delivery efficiency

requirements.description:
About the Project

At Geoscience Australia in Canberra, there are two robotic systems: one is small Geo++ robot which was built for Global Navigation Satellite Signal (GNSS) antenna calibrations; and a Kuka robot, which was built for GNSS antenna calibrations with heavier payloads (>10kg) and other research applications. 

This project is to develop an operational GNSS antenna calibration facility using the Kuka robot. We are seeking a robotic engineer to develop the robotic antenna calibration program, the work details are listed as below: 

  1. Develop robotic machine language (Kuka robotic language, KRL) scripts to talk to the Kuka robot to move in parallel to the Geo++ robot;
  2. Develop scripts to work out the geometric relationship for each modules to control the Kuka robot for orientating GNSS antenna;
  3. Develop scripts to link the Kuka robot and GNSS receiver antennas to log data for post processing of GNSS antenna calibrations;
  4. Integrating the above scripts/functions into a software package for GNSS antenna calibrations;
  5. Documentation of the above development scripts/functions.

(see attached requirement document for the full description)

The successful seller will need to ensure at least one engineer work with the project in full time with claimed skills.
Skill and knowledge in writing robotic language programming, Kuka robot experience desirable, preferring to providing examples of past work with similar project.

The request seeks to engage an experienced service provider who has the capability to provide:

Introduction

The Department of Defence with an enterprise-wide video based/digital online learning platform.

The video based/digital online learning platform needs to help all staff gain new skills and advance their professional careers. The aim is to provide just-in-time learning that features instructional content relevant to employee’s professional and personal interests and goals. Requirement

The enterprise wide video based/digital online learning platform for whole of Defence will:

  1. Provide unlimited access for users covering a wide range of topics such as leadership, business, creative skills and technology.
  2. Offer personalised recommendations and explore the most in-demand skills/reward based on each personal experience.
  3. Provide learning content by industry expert instructors, learn from industry leaders and provide a hands on approach to learning.
  4. Provide access to courses anywhere anytime as a convenient approach to learning, accessible from any desktop or mobile device.
  5. Offer self-paced learning with bite sized video content.
  6. Provide additional resources for each topic to reinforce new knowledge with quizzes and exercise files with the reward of certifications on completion of course.
  7. As required the seller (and online learning platform) will provide customised playlists on specific subject matters as requested by Defence.
  8. Provide function/service where individual Defence learners can download their learning history from the online platform and mobile application.

requirements.description:
The Department of Parliamentary Services (DPS) is seeking the services of an experienced Business Analyst to support its Electronic Security Systems (ESS) Enhancements Program. The Business Analyst will work with Subject Matter Experts (SME’s) to document system configuration and operational security responses required to meet the APH Security Operating Environment. The Business Analyst will produce use cases, process maps and supporting documentation that will form the Electronic Security System Event Manual and companion standard operating procedures and training materials.

To deliver on this program of works, the Business Analyst will be required to work within the Security Branch to:

  • Lead a range of stakeholder engagements to clarify, analyse and define security operational responses to electronic security system events
  • Collaborate with technical analysts and the alarms and alerts workflow enhancement team to support the design and development of solutions for responses to electronic security system events
  • Undertake data analysis of electronic security system events to inform the prioritisation of project work packages
  • Develop recommendations for the appropriate response to electronic security system events through analysis, verification, and validation
  • Provide input into the development of testing material and support testing activities with security operational and technical stakeholders
  • Work with security operations training and security policy and governance teams to update standard operating procedures and training materials to implement and operationalise the resulting changes to policy, process and procedure.
  • Other related activities to support the successful delivery as required

data.value: This role is within the Security Capability business team and will be based full-time onsite at Australian Parliament House.

requirements.description:
Parks Australia has a suite of six mobile apps which have been built by an external development agency. The mobile apps showcase Parks Australia’s national parks and botanic gardens and provide information to visitors including tours, activities, cultural heritage, environment and maps. The apps are publicly available through the iOS and Android app stores.

The Director of National Parks is seeking an external provider to deliver ongoing technical maintenance, security and monitoring of the mobile apps for Parks Australia for a 12 month period. Timely (within 1 business day for critical issues and within 1 week for non-urgent issues) technical support is required to resolve any issues encountered by the client.

A key requirement is ensuring the apps function consistently and correctly on the latest version of iOS and Android operating systems. This is a requirement of having the apps published on their respective app stores.

Informing the client of any changes to technology and policies which may affect the ability to publish updates to the apps (such as iOS upgrades or cybersecurity incidents), investigating the impacts of any changes on the client’s business, and actioning any changes required to ensure the apps are always accessible to users.

data.label: Working arrangements
data.value: Monthly status reporting, fortnightly meetings, ad-hoc urgent meetings as required over a 12 month period.

essential.desc: Demonstrated skills in building, publishing, and maintaining Android and iOS mobile applications
Demonstrated experience working to Australian government application development standards
Dedicated in-house skills for: • React Native framework • JavaScript (ES6 compliant) • Tailwind CSS • Expo framework • AWS Lamba functions
Demonstrated experience in building and/or managing mobile applications using Expo

Demonstrated experience in 3rd Party online services that the mobile apps leverage: • GitHub and GitHub Actions • Google Firebase • MapTiler • Google Maps API • Monitoring of restricted API endpoints used by apps
